intro: Hieracium collinum subsp. trichoderma, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are hairy and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to colonize and thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
